revised_title: Influence of Pressure on Spontaneous Ignition and Inflammability of Ether-Air Mixtures
tldr: This study investigates the influence of pressure on the spontaneous ignition and limits of inflammability of ether-air mixtures. The authors discovered two distinct ignition systems, with the lower system developing at higher initial pressures in the temperature range where cool flames are typically observed. They also found a new phenomenon of green flames propagating between 330-365°C, which is unique to ether-air mixtures.
